Reviews.Title: “owner/manager very rude”
Reviews.Author: bethgrant1199
Reviews.Content: We were really excited by the art inside this hotel, but we never got to see it because the day manager would not turn on the lights. He told us that there was natural light but that was coming from windows 50 feet away. Their continental breakfast was hideous. The coffee, supposidly American was undrinkable. No matter what the issue, the bottom line was the day manager was extremly inflexable and a penny pincher. Not a good combination in a hotel mamger.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but not the best breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Cdaz2012
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, but I was a little thrown off by the great review in Rick Steve's when I discovered I was staying at a two-star hotel. However, despite that - the rooms were clean and plenty large. The staff was helpful, so I don't understand the fuss about that, and the location was incredible. My only complaint would be the breakfast - it would be nice to have something a little more substantial because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “OK, what's all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: foodiefromCO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January, 2012. Don't see where the complaints about owner are coming from, a lugubrious fellow, but perfectly OK. Lots of Italian hotel and B and B owners ask to be paid in cash, no problem, no credit card transaction fee! Room was perfectly fine, bath, small ,but quite adequate. Breakfast a little skimpy. Heat was fine, had no experience with AC so couldn't comment. Beautiful public room. WIFI worked in lobby, and breakfast room. Very quiet location, on a small square, no noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Travelbound13
Reviews.Content: Great all around! The hotel is in a hidden away little court, that is shared with a church. The church's claim to fame is it is the church that Vavaldi was baptised in. It is an easy 3-5 minute walk to San Marco Square. The room was a little small, but it was a single bed and I was traveling by myself and I paid about 75 Euros for the night. That price in the city is very hard to find. The desk clerk was friendly. She gave tips on how to avoid the crowds and where to get real Venice food, and not the tourist trap rigatoni with tomato sauce. I only stayed one night, and left before breakfast. So, I can't comment on that part. If I was traveling with family this hotel might not have worked out so well. If you are on your own, or traveling on business, or its just you and your signifigant other this hotel is a gem. If you are travelling with more than 2 people, find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “top value, nice large room and good view, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Christophe B
Reviews.Content: 3 nigths in a large room with a view on a street and a view on the square, very clean, quiet, modern bathroom, great place for breakfast, close to everything we wanted to see (Biennale, Palazzo Grassi, etc...), at a super price (270â‚¬ 3 nights!), my GF happy too, that's the most important!! Ok, breakfast not that big, who cares ! I'll go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: tbbbnbab
Reviews.Content: Overall, I liked this hotel. We had a large room with a very large bathroom and a great shower. The woman who worked the main desk was very friendly and helpful. The location was very convenient to St. Marco and the vaporetto stop. However, I must agree with others that the breakfast was not very good, and there was a strange swampy smell in the lower foyer. However, that smell did not affect our room, so we were not bothered by it. The price for this hotel was very attractive, so I feel that I got a good value, but the next time I travel to Venice, I will spend a bit more to get something a little bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Italy we stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: E2hemker
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be our big splurge. We payed for a room with a "view". This was the most expensive room in all our travels including Rome and Florence. The room and lobby STUNK! AWFUL GAG SMELL! Thank god it was cool we slept with the window open. The manager/owner was a complete jerk and spoke terrible english. The food was awful and the coffee was even worse. They were snooty about this awful plastic dump. The only thing historic in the hotel was the main breakfast room. The WIFI didn't really work EVEN sitting next to the router in the Lobby. The rooms were large (the largest in all Italy) but the view was of a square (there are no canal views), but all the furniture is old crappy painted k-mart pieces, the floor is laminate, the walls and rest plastic and cheap new. Why am I so pissed?! I paid over $1000 for 4 nights in a "historical palace" and I got a plastic cheap motel with snobby jerks running the place. Save your money and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and elegance rolled into one”
Reviews.Author: Caz M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel La Residenza in early September after receiving a recommendation from a friend and couldn't have been happier with my choice. The hotel itself has an old style glamour that you can only dream of and was surprisingly inexpensive, especially when you consider the handy location (from memory ... a 10 minute leisurely walk to Piazza San Marco). Breakfast is a simple affair, but you will be eating it in La Residenza's glamorous dining room (complete with grand piano) ... so honestly ... how could anyone complain. My single bedroom was small but well appointed, with lovely little touches of detail, such as stenciling around the bedhead and wardrobe. I even had a Murano glass chandelier to marvel at. Nestled in peaceful Campo Bandiera e Moro (where children play games and locals walk their dogs) you have a calm area to retreat to when the tourist hot spots become too much for you. And on a final note, the people who staff the reception desk are always courteous, welcoming and extremely helpful. I hope to return to Venice one day ... and if I do ... I will definitely consider staying here again. Regards from Caz

Reviews.Title: “Indeed a shoebox with a door !”
Reviews.Author: mamadoc
Reviews.Content: We can confirm that there are rooms the size of a shoebox with a bathroom the size of a matchbox. Even a couple of dwarfs would be crowded !!! Though the hotel was half empty the manager refused a transfer to another room. Breakfast was basic and unpleasant due to the horrible waiter. Fawlty towers would be paradise compared to this. We confirm previous reviews and regret not reading them properly before booking this hotel. Come to Venice but try to find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, cash payment”
Reviews.Author: MB219
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel's location (very near San Marco). The rooms were spacious with nice atmosphere, and continental breakfast was good. The staff I experienced were all helpful. The only concern I had was finding out at check-in that the "owner preferred cash." I had paid cash at hotels the previous 5 nights (which had been no big deal since I had been notified in the initial emails). No mention of this cash preference from this hotel, I had to go find an ATM early in the morning before check-out because I felt pressured.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance but ...”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for the atmosphere. Location is about 10 minute walk to St. Marks Square along the lagoon and Grand Canal. The owner is task but not service oriented. Fulvia, who is on duty at the front desk in the afternoons and early evenings, is wonderful. She went out of her way to help us, even when we had some unusual requests. Very clean. So-so continental breakfast. Note: be prepared to carry your bags up a flight of stairs from the plaza to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back to Venice next September (2012)!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly P
Reviews.Content: My 76 year old mother and I stayed in a room in mid-September 2011 for 2 nights just beside the kitchen and from the moment I left Venice (this was my first trip to Italy) I've been trying to figure out how soon I can get back...this hotel, and Venice, were fabulous. Yes, we were right off the kitchen but we never heard any noise from the breakfast prep. Yes, the room was darker than the pictures but we were out from around 10am to 11pm (tours, walking and walking and walking, the opera (wonderful!), an Interpreti Veneziana concert (even better!!)) so it really didn't matter. And I don't know where all these sour-pusses everyone is mentioning were - I have nothing but praise for the help and smiles I received from the 3 staff members I dealt with. Yes, the breakfast wasn't anything to get too excited about (orange juice, regular coffee (they do not have an espresso machine but for 1.3 euros you can get a fabulous cappucino or latte around alley on the left corner), sweet breads) - but it's a 2 star hotel with EXTREMELY reasonable prices...go eat a larger lunch or dinner in one of the fabulous restaurants you pass by!!! And I loved the location...just "down the path" from Piazza San Marco...so close to the action, as everything is in Venice, but far enough way from the night-time action so you can get a good night's sleep to be ready to go back out and get lost in this magical city. And it's just one block off the Grand Canal so we felt completely safe walking around late at night. My next email is to book a single room in this hotel for 5 nights next September 2012. The email after that will be to book additional tours with the ArtViva Tour Group - the gondola and walking tour, San Marco tour, Doges Palace tour and Grand Canal tour I took were absolutely fabulous - I can't say enough about how informative and entertaining my 2 guides were! (I did a combination of 9 tours in Venice, Florence and Rome with ArtViva and all 9 were fabulous.) Kelly Porter, Vancouver, BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “great 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: yumosh
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very big and beautifully decorated. Great for a 2 star hotel. very convinient location- very close to main vaporetto stops. The staff was helpful.The owner is a polite man. This is a 2 star hotel so I don't understand the complains about AC not being on all day. The breakfast was moderate, but the ambiance of the room was great. I was afraid to stay in a 2-star hotel in Italy, but I was wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but what a sour lot!”
Reviews.Author: CalliePotters
Reviews.Content: This is really a beautiful hotel and very well located. The place is very Venitian. But the management is easily the most unfriendly and most sour lot I have encountered in all my years of travel. We were kicked out one morning by a screaming owner, because he wanted to have the locked fixed. We did not break the lock, in fact we did not even notice that anything was wrong with it. We were booked to stay another two days and had to vacate the room for the best part of the day, so they could do their maintenance work. When we did not move fast enough to his taste, I was screamed at to vacate the room "NOW"! During the whole time there we could not elicit a smile out of one of them. Not worth the trouble to go back there again. Venice is too beautiful with many other options.

Reviews.Title: “so so hotel with very unpleasant manager but good location”
Reviews.Author: nick_from_vietnam
Reviews.Content: room was very big (family room on first floor), nicely decorated but extremely dark (windows looking on a one meter large dark street). it felt as if staying in a cave... air conditioning is shut off during morning: this was a problem for my family as we are not very fast to get ready in the morning (we have two young children). it was impossible to get fresh air from our windows overlooking the street. breakfast was terrible: too few tables and only one person bringing food for all the guests: as a result, we had to wait a long time to be seated and one seated we had to wait more to get served. and finally food was quite bad... to be fair, the breakfast room is gorgeous: it feels like a museum. but we had breakfast there only once during our 4 day stay as we decided the poor quality of the breakfast was not worth the wait after our first day. Now the worst: the staff. the female employees were quite nice but the man (who may be the manager) was not friendly and not helpful at all. he gave me the impression to look down on his guests. he was reluctant to give information about the area and the information he gave me about the most convenient way to go back to the parking island.was wrong. Our feeling was that the guy knew that no matter what people would come to his property so he did not need to care. I found it ironic that he asked to be partly paid in cash without offering a discount when i checked out (which i refused). I would not recommend my friends and family to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Owner was arrogant and rude!!”
Reviews.Author: M D
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read all of the reviews on this hotel before I booked it. I would have noticed a pattern. Owner wouldn't turn on the AC and then he demanded we pay in cash!! We stayed there for one night and the owner noted that guests staying one night are required to pay in cash. There was no mention of that in the confirmation of terms I received when I booked the hotel, months earlier. Listen to this. A young couple also staying in the hotel were complaining about the lack of AC. The husband told Mr. arrogant and rude that his wife needs the AC because of her asthma. HE WOULDN'T TURN IT ON!! Mr arrogant and rude said to him, "You Americans always make trouble". Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: northe99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. We read about the hotel in Rick Steves and it was exactly as described. During check-in and breakfast in the spectacular main room you feel like your back at the height of the Venetian Republic. That being said, I was a little disappointed in our actual room. It was located on a mezzanine level and had much lower ceilings than those pictured on the website. We chose a Deluxe room because of the window feature, which was nice, although at times a little loud because it was over a shop and overlooking the square. Overall I'd recommend the hotel, it did seem a nice value compared to the prices/locations of some of the other hotels we were looking at. It was really nice to be off the beaten path, as the crowds at times on the main tourist trail were oppressive.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Illini4
Reviews.Content: I get all of my hotel recommendations from Rick Steve's travel books and then I cross check them here on Trip Advisor. The hotel was clean, the bed was comfortable, the free breakfast was enough to get us started for the day and the location was very good (not in the hustle bustle but not too far). I've heard Venice has a lot of great hotels and La Residenza is the only one I have experience with, I would stay again. The owner is pretty stingy with the A/C, he turns the power to the A/C unit off at 7 am promptly every morning and turns in back on at night. This was not a big deal for my wife and I since we were out in the city during the day. One day we did come back to the room before dinner to freshen up for a nice dinner, I just went up to the front desk and asked the woman working at the time to turn it on until I was done showering and getting dressed. When I turned my key in to go out I let her know we were leaving and she could turn it off again. My wife and I really enjoyed the ambiance from the building (the heavy wood door with the large iron circle handle was fun). There is free Wifi, but it only works in the breakfast room. I'd prefer if it reached the rooms as well. I don't understand why some hotels limit the reach of Wifi, seems to defeat the purpose to me.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss. Make sure you know what you are getting!”
Reviews.Author: lekingjd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the family apartments with our 2 boys. The room was clean and plenty of room for our family. However, the owner is extremely difficult. We arrived after a horrible overnight train ride. We were hot and tired, and were advised that although the hotel advertises AC you are only supposed to get it at night. After i had a minor melt down the owner turned on the AC while we unpacked, and then promptly turned it off the minute we left the room. He also asked my husband as we were checking in to pay him in cash. As you know the personal withdrawal limits at ATM's make that option impossible. Further, I was using my credit card to pay. Don't waste your time or energy on the daily breakfast included in your rate it is nescafe and prepackged croissants. We did decide that the location was excellent fair enough away from the crowds and close to the locals. We found an excellent wine shop right around the corner with a lovely lady selling excellent bottles and wine by the liter. I suggest that this owner work on his people skills or hire someone else to run things. He is very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: badasssue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It is in a central location close to the square but far enough for you to feel like you are with the locals. The breakfast was total yum and the staff were professional. We had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible salon, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: SaraCollins83
Reviews.Content: If you want to witness Venice as enjoyed by locals I would recommend Hotel La Residenza. The square is filled in the afternoon with Venetians - children playing, elderly ladies sitting under the trees watching the world go by - and a church whose bells toll on the hour. The hotel rooms with a view give you a perfect spot to witness all of this in basic comfort. The rooms are appointed in typical Mediterranean style with tiled floors, white bed-sheets, simple bathroom, ample storage space and all very clean. The entrance is through a big door way and up a flight of stone stairs and into the salon which is completely venetian with stuccoed walls and beamed ceilings. The hotel is nothing special but comfortable to come back to after a long day adventuring. The continental breakfast is simple although there isn't really any atmosphere with most guests sitting very quietly. You go to Venice to enjoy the city and fundamentally your accommodation just needs to be clean and quiet and I can heartily recommend La Residenza as just that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value fir Venice but won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: Darlenehixon
Reviews.Content: This bed and breakfast is not located in the St Marco district as we were led to believe, though it's bit a bad walk to the district. The bed and breakfast was eerily quiet, nit pleasant quiet. The owner, was efficient but was nit accommodating or friendly ad you would hope your host or hostess would be. It us purely business at hand. One lady from the US requested another croissant and was told "no" that there was only one per person. We were originally given a room that we were not promised and we had to point that out and it was changed. The Internet is on again off again if that's a need for the customer. We had to ask about the a/c after being bitten by Mosquitos through the night. We do not recommend this hotel or B&B. It is definitely not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking - the hotel sold us a shoebox with a door”
Reviews.Author: APODOPOULOS
Reviews.Content: And when we wanted to leave, they we were threatened with, they had our credit card details....the room was 2 m wide and 4 m long, had no light with a rather low sealing. The smell was horendas and the price was Eur 179.00. I am surprised that anyone with some sense would dare to sell a shoebox like that, unbelievable. So I regret because the place looked nice from the outside. Shame the owner wasn't honest about the room they were selling and then even threatening. In the end we left.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: bvoquin
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the great recommendation in the Rick Steve's Italy guide, along with Trip Advisors reviews. Unfortunately, we did not have a good experience. The owner was on the grumpy side, which made it a little uncomfortable, they placed us on the lower floor, almost even with the street, so there wasn't any privacy. The room was located right above the trattoria (restaurant) and their little piazza. We had to listen to the entire neighborhood's kids play and the folks in the trattoria until very late. Because they don't turn on the air conditioning except during a few months out of the year (we stayed early May so it wasn't on), our room was too hot. We opened the window but ended up getting bit by mosquitoes all night. Breakfast was subpar. Beds were too firm, pillows flat as pancakes. The entire experience was awful. We had really looked forward to staying here but were greatly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to stay , close to everything, quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: PaloVII
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel while over 35 deg C outside, clean, big and air conditioned room. Very good breakfast. On the nice quiet square. It is walking distance(few minutes) to everything: main square, ferry, restaurants. Didn't even had reservations when we arrived, but receptionist helped us and we got great room on the first floor. You can even bargain a little bit. Cheaper than most of the hotels, but you get same and more.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat with a Grand Salon”
Reviews.Author: MojoLad
Reviews.Content: We began our Italian odyssey in Venice, so it was nice to be somewhat off the beaten track where it was quieter so we could get over our jet-lag; also, the piazza (Campo Bandiera e Moro) in front of the hotel featured a little hardware store, which was extremely useful. The off-season (December) rates were good, and the breakfast of fine quality. The main salon in which one dines is astonishing, like a museum, with immense paintings, plaster fretwork, chandeliers and more. The room was quite modern, very clean, with an excellent bathroom; also, free Wi-fi is available once you manage to log in to the incredible password. The staff were very helpful, even when only in command of limited English. The only off-putting detail was the ground floor entrance, which always smelled vaguely of sewage -- but halfway up the steps, the smell disappeared, so it was only an issue down at the doorway.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Venice. Below average amenities and service.”
Reviews.Author: John816
Reviews.Content: Two weeks traveling in Europe and this was the only poor experience after 6 hotels. I read many reviews on the site weighing the positive with the negative ones before booking. Bottom line is don't stay here. Read on for details why. We arrived on a blistering 90 degree afternoon early September. The hotel sits on a nice square and walking distance to all the sites. Once we checked in we found no airconditioning. The owner turns it off Sept. 1st with no exceptions (come to find out he turns it off in the early AM in the summer too). We faced the square and had no other option than to open the window to the noisy(til after midnight) square below. Even though I requested a rear room the place was booked and the owner would not move us. The owner/managers attitude was you can stay in that room or you may look for another hotel because I am booked. The room was clean but the bed was like a rock as well as the pillows. Made our Venice experience a tiring visit. Last but not least is the never ending sewer smell in the 1st floor entryway. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden gem, yet so close to centre”
Reviews.Author: pattiNorthEast
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Arsenale drop off we did not have a clue where to go, but after walking a few minutes we literally stumbled upon this gem of a hotel. In a little square just off a main throughfare, but so quiet at night. A short walk through a few back streets lined with shops, bars and restaurants takes you to St Marks Square, and then onto the other must see's in Venice. Our triple room was ideal, clean and bright. Lovely modern shower room. Frederica on the desk was so lovely and helpful, nothing was too much trouble, extra pillows, ensuring we were happy with our return water taxi transfer etc. Breakfast was adequate for us, we do not expect a full course, buffet breakfast in Italy. Beautiful decor and furniture, it really has character and may original features - our room had a lovely beamed ceiling. Free safe in rooms, no deposit required, you are given a key and you keep it for your stay. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Venice in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: One-of-17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our 10 year old daughter stayed in an elegant triple room overlooking a peaceful square. We were a short walk off the the Grand Canal away from the hustle and bustle. Our extended family had the other two rooms in our "wing" as well as the 3 rooms across the hall. It felt like we were staying in our own private palace. It's a beautiful hotel in a great location, near St. Mark's Square. I would definitely stay here again. We had no problems with the air conditioning being turned off.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: BuzzDR
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel on a quiet square. The location was very peaceful - the perfect balance between good proximity to the tourist highlights (close to San Marco) and a serene setting. The rooms were clean and the staff was tremendous. An excellent value. The included breakfast was excellent. Good free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: feedthecats
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 5 min walk away from the main tourist attraction site, San Marco which is really convenient. We never found the air conditioning to be a problem. As soon as we got back t the hotel, the manager would turn it on for us. Though they switch it off in the morning, it remains cool enough t stay in till about 10 to 11 am. Breakfast was free and service was excellent as they actually serve it to you. The dining room where we ate breakfast in was lovely, and was decorated with paintings and victorian furniture. We had problems with our internet initially too, but was promptly solved by the manager, who actually called and double checked if our internet is working fine. Awesome stay, reasonable prices, great service and would definitely recommend my friends and family to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: KPDenver
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other reviews. Air conditioning is turned off at 7am (despite the fact that the outside temperatures were in the upper 90's) and the manager was incredibly rude about it. We explained that there were 4 of us in a room facing the alley (no air passage) and that we woke up as the room was stifling. The manager (an older gentleman) said that "ONLY THE AMERICANS EVER COMPLAIN!" and refused to turn it on. They should not be able to advertise "air conditioning" if they don't turn it on. The internet did not work and this same manager said he could do nothing about it. I found out later all he had to do was reset the router. Breakfast is unsatisfactory. The only pleasant part of our stay was the young lady who was there the second morning of our stay. It's a shame really because the hotel is in a nice location and the lobby has great character. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “where's the air conditioning?”
Reviews.Author: mcjrubin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last year and were so satisfied that we decided to stay there again. The hotel indicated that it was air conditioned which was important to us. Upon arriving at the hotel, the clerk turned on the the air, however we awoke at 0700 to find that it had been abruptly shut off, and we were told to open the windows. This is not what I had in mind-to try and sleep in a "hot" room, with the sun shining in, listening and smelling street odors. It was definitely a disappointment. Otherwise, the facility itself is lovely and has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good price - great hist. building - good room”
Reviews.Author: 30andtravelalot
Reviews.Content: told by a friend about this place, we realy liked this hotel. wonderful old building, great and central location, quite. and all this for a great price. The breakfast is the only thing wich will not make you happy. Poor as any italian hotelbreakfast it's better to take a capucco and a sweet at the cafe. PS: Avoid the supercrowded city during the day and explore it in the evening/night (lonely).

Reviews.Title: “Many Good Qualities”
Reviews.Author: basieboo
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at the Hotel La Residenza in Venice, Italy. The hotel was listed in the Rick Steves guidebook and tripadvisor.com reviews were generally favorable. I would also recommend this hotel, as it is very convenient to the St Mark's Square area, but far enough of away from the madding crowd to ensure peace & quiet at night. It is located in a historic building that oozes Renaissance ambiance. The cleanliness factor was actually quite good, and I have rather severe OCD issues. For a hotel, this one was maintained decently. However, as with most hotels in Italy, the showers are excessively small, which really grosses me out. If only they would dispense with those unsightly bidets and the revolting imagery they subsequently conjure, there would easily be room for a full-sized shower. Also, breakfast was rather insipid affair, with only ersatz coffee & juice, and bread, bread, and more bread. A carbohydrate overload, to be sure. The service also left something to be desired, although the night manager (a portly Asian guy) assisted me, in his peculiarly comatose way, while I frantically attempted to locate my lost luggage. I somehow suspect the manager/owner would not have been so accommodating, as he had a subtle way of making one feel like something he just scraped off his shoe. One day, I was cold and tired and sick to death of lukewarm, overpriced cappuccino (which is 3/4 foam anyway!), so I asked the manager if I might prevail upon him for a cup of coffee to enjoy in my room. He seemed appalled that I should suggest such a thing, and I was made to feel that I should apologize for my provincial misstep. Overall, however, my opinion is that the positive attributes of the hotel outweighed the negative, and I would consider staying here again if I should ever find myself in Venice, which I probably won't - it's overrated and overpriced, as is the rest of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “An old, roomy hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ConnTravelor
Reviews.Content: Finding this hotel the first time can be tricky since it doesn't really look like a hotel. You enter by ringing a bell and getting buzzed in. Once you enter, there's no doubt you are in an old, historic hotel with high ceilings and ornate fixtures. Our room had plenty of space and large shuttered windows that swung open for lots of fresh air. Breakfast is in a classic dining room and is the usual fare of breads and yogurt cups. The service was great. The location is actually very close to the Grand Canal and St. Mark's, once you get your bearings this becomes apparent. The hotel is located on a square, which would be lovely without all the trash bags piled around (it just seems to be the way they handle trash all around the island so you have to overlook it). If you don't want to hear occasional passerbys talking loudly at night, have them turn the AC on, but we opted for the fresh air and occasional voice in the night. A good choice for an authentic Venice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great wifi”
Reviews.Author: amadpuzzo
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying in the La Residenza twice during the month of June, on two separate trips. The location, at the Campo Bandieri e Mori is quiet, yet only two bridges away from St. Mark's. The Church in the campo where the hotel sits is where Vivaldi was baptized. The cafe opposite is great for a beer or a coffee, while working on your computer through wifi. The concierge is a bit officious, a bit of a [--], really. But then that's part of the charm as well. The rooms are small, but comfortable, and the building is a wonderfully restored palazzo, from the Gritti family. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, great price”
Reviews.Author: haley2334
Reviews.Content: The location was very good, walking distance to St. Marc's square and the water taxi stop. It is located in a very quiet Piazza just off the main street to St. Marc's. There are many shops and restaurants right there. The hotel is very charming inside but the room we had was very small. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Rrad
Reviews.Content: Good location and price/value but furnishings cheap. Bed and linens fair. Located on a large square where children play - noisy after 8 AM but quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Bargain in an otherwise Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: Friedman1962
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel on the recommendation of the Frommerâ€™s guide, but got a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. However, I must say we had a great experience here. Our room was on the first floor (room 225) and was large and clean. There were 3 of us staying in the room and we were never tripping over each other. You can tell that the bathroom was recently updated and it was quite nice. Breakfast was barely adequate, but it was exactly what you should expect under these type of circumstances. It was exactly what we had come to expect in our travels across Italy. The location was perfect for us, and you should definitely not miss the church next door. I would also strongly recommend the RISTARANTE AL COVO around the corner and less than 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Considering the exorbitant prices for almost everything in Venice, this hotel turned out to be a bargain.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Residenza
HotelInfo.Address: Campo Bandiera e Moro, 3608, 30122 Venice, Italy
